item.title: My Repos for Learning
item.description: I have got several Gihub repos for learning: using cli, linux and WSL using pandoc as citation manager general programming tips and book references superhero to teach IT to business analysts visualisation techniques and probably others, listed in lighttable There are way too many repos. It would be nice to publish them under one roof and single contents.

item.title: Julia Programming Language Introduction
item.description: DEV.to article “Julia, surprise me!” maps my learning of the Julia programming language as a series of pleasant and less satisfying surprises. Since then my biggest roadblock to Julia was the recompilation time of the dependencies. Not much fun seeing your code execute in milliseconds, if you have to wait a minute for a dependency to ‘precompile’. Repeating that in cylces each time you run a test is not good.

item.title: Setting Up Academic Theme
item.description: Academic theme is great, well-thought in design and popular with users. Below is a track record of my site setup using Hugo and Academic. Precursor I’m migrating from a Jekyll-based CV theme to Academic. CV had a clean look and helped me to sort out my personal information, but it was not easily extensible. I did set it up once on Github Pages and rarely updated.
